2. Intellectual Property

3. User Responsibilities

4. Disclaimer

5. Limitation of Liability

PrivacyText:
Last Updated: December 2025

1. Introduction
Dunn-Carabali, LLC ('we', 'us', or 'our') operates this mobile application. This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data when you use our Service.

2. Information Collection and Use
We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you, including:
- Personal Data (e.g., email address, name)
- Usage Data (e.g., device type, operating system)

3. Use of Data
Dunn-Carabali, LLC uses the collected data to provide and maintain the Service, notify you about changes, provide customer support, and monitor usage.

4. Disclosure of Data
We may disclose your Personal Data in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to comply with a legal obligation, protect and defend the rights or property of Dunn-Carabali, LLC, or protect the personal safety of users.

5. Security of Data
The security of your data is important to us, but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

6. Changes to This Policy
We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.

7. Contact Us
If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact Dunn-Carabali, LLC.

title: Family Settings
rotation_description: Use this function if a family member cannot access encrypted bills after a new device install or re-login. This process is secure but requires the member to log in again.
rotation_success_message: A new key has been generated and shared with all members. Affected members must relaunch the app to sync.
rotation_error: Failed to rotate key. Please try again or contact support.
members_remove_confirm_message: Are you sure you want to remove {name} from the family?
members_leave_confirm_message: Are you sure you want to leave the family? You will lose access to all shared bills.
reminders_offset_description: How many days before the due date should the reminder be sent?
reminders_time_description: The time of day the reminder notification should be sent (local time).

items.q: How do I add a debt?
items.a: Go to the Debts screen and tap the '+ Add' button. Enter the creditor, amount, and due date to save.

items.q: How do I edit or update a debt?
items.a: Tap any debt in the list to open the edit screen where you can update its details.

items.q: How do I delete a debt?
items.a: Select a debt, then tap the 'Delete' button to remove it permanently.

items.q: What happens when I mark a debt as paid?
items.a: It moves to the Paid section and future reminders for that debt stop automatically.

items.q: When will I receive reminders?
items.a: You will receive a reminder the day before a debt is due. Your group settings may adjust this reminder window.

items.q: Why am I not receiving notifications?
items.a: Ensure notifications are enabled for the app in your device settings. Also confirm you're logged in and part of a Group.

items.q: Will reminders sync across all devices?
items.a: Yes. All connected group members receive reminders for shared debts.

items.q: Can I share my account with someone else?
items.a: Yes. Share your Share ID so other users can join your group group and sync bills.

items.q: How do I invite someone to my group?
items.a: Go to your Profile or Group screen to find your Share ID. Give this ID to someone you trust so they can join.

items.q: Can multiple people manage the same debts?
items.a: Absolutely. Anyone in your group group can add, edit, pay, or delete shared debts.

items.q: Can I leave a group?
items.a: Yes. You can leave from the group Settings screen. If you're the only admin, you must assign a new admin first.

items.q: How does the Import Code work?
items.a: Group admins can generate a one-time import code. Use it in the Bulk Upload screen to securely import debts from a CSV file.

items.q: What file type can I import?
items.a: You can import CSV files containing the fields: name, amount, due_date, notes, autopay.

items.q: Can I import multiple debts at once?
items.a: Yes. Use the Bulk Upload feature to import many debts from a spreadsheet in one step.

items.q: Why did my import fail?
items.a: Check that your CSV uses valid formatting and that your Import Code has not expired or already been used.

items.q: How do I sign in?
items.a: You can sign in using Apple Sign-In or Google Sign-In depending on your device.

items.q: Is my data secure?
items.a: Yes. Your data is protected with encrypted authentication tokens and stored securely on the server.

items.q: Will my data sync across devices?
items.a: Yes. As long as you sign in with the same Apple or Google account, your data syncs automatically.

items.q: If I import bills via CSV, are they encrypted immediately?
items.a: To ensure maximum privacy, BillBell uses 'End-to-End Encryption.' This means the encryption key lives only on your device, not on our servers. When you upload a CSV file for bulk import, our server processes it to create the bills. Since our server does not (and should not) have your private encryption key, it cannot encrypt the data of these imported bills. They are stored as plain text initially. How to secure them: Once you open the app and your phone downloads the new imported bills, they will work normally. If you edit and save an imported bill, the app will automatically encrypt it using the key on your device, securing it from that point forward.

items.q: Why Can't I See My Bills Anymore (Decryption Failed)?
items.a: This issue usually happens on a new device or immediately after reinstalling the app, where your device doesn't have the current Family Encryption Key stored. The app uses a unique set of cryptographic keys to protect your family's data. If your new device's Public Key was not synchronized with the server before the latest key was generated, the app cannot decrypt the Family Key.

items.q: How to Fix Decryption Failure
items.a: The problem can only be resolved by a family Admin running a Key Rotation: Admin Action: A user with an Admin role must go to Family Settings and select 'Rotate Family Encryption Key'. What Rotation Does: This process generates a brand new key and re-encrypts that key specifically for every member using their latest Public Key on file. Your Action: After the Admin completes the rotation, fully close and relaunch the app on your problematic device. The app will download the new key and your bills will reappear. Note: If the issue persists after the Admin rotates the key, you may need to Log Out and Log In again to force a complete reset of your local device keys.

items.q: Does the app support Dark Mode?
items.a: Yes. The app automatically adapts to your device's appearance settings.

items.q: Can I change my reminder settings?
items.a: Group admins can update default reminder times in Group Settings.

items.q: Can I change my Share ID?
items.a: No. Share IDs are unique system-generated identifiers and cannot be changed.

items.q: How should I enter amounts?
items.a: Enter the full amount without symbols. For example, '150.25' becomes $150.25.

items.q: Can I track auto-pay bills?
items.a: Yes. You can mark debts as auto-pay when creating or editing them.

items.q: My bills aren't updating on another device. What should I do?
items.a: Ensure both devices are logged into the same Group. Pull down on the Debts screen to refresh.

items.q: I accidentally deleted a debt. Can I restore it?
items.a: No. Deleted debts cannot be recovered, so delete carefully.
